thread.title: Paris: 'Protestors' Blockade Schools With Burning Rubbish
thread.title_full: Paris: 'Protestors' Blockade Schools With Burning Rubbish

author: breitbart.com
title: Paris: 'Protestors' Blockade Schools With Burning Rubbish
text:
Paris: Tear Gas Deployed As ‚ÄòProtestors‚Äô Blockade Schools With Burning Rubbish GEOFFROY VAN DER HASSELT/AFP/Getty Images by Jack Montgomery
Hooded youths armed with flares are mingling with crowds of so-called ‚Äúprotestors‚Äù in Paris, blockading schools with burning rubbish bins and barriers of assorted debris. Reports indicate that over a dozen schools have been shut down, with a school district spokesman admitting ‚Äúextra security measures‚Äù have been taken at sixteen. Twelve more are ‚Äúotherwise disrupted‚Äù.
Feu de poubelles au lyc√©e #Bergson dans le 19e pendant le blocus contre les violences polici√®res pic.twitter.com/tCMDi6VSsy
‚Äî Chlo√© Marriault (@Chloe_Pmr) February 23, 2017
Blocus au lyc√©e Maurice Ravel dans le XX√®me, impossible d'entrer pour le moment pic.twitter.com/XmtX0yQNFT
‚Äî Chlo√© Marriault (@Chloe_Pmr) February 23, 2017
The police have reported a number of arrests after officers were bombarded with rocks and other projectiles.
#manifestation √† Nation. Jets de projectiles sur les forces de l'ordre. Pour l'heure 8 interpellations pour vols en r√©union, d√©gradations‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/CKT0QHb2Rl
‚Äî Pr√©fecture de police (@prefpolice) February 23, 2017
Crowds have also marched on the Place de la Nation in eastern Paris, reportedly carrying banners reading ‚ÄúVengeance for Theo‚Äù in reference to a man who was allegedly assaulted by police officers earlier in February 2017.
Tensions were high, with a helicopter overhead and tear gas deployed against aggressive groups of protestors.
Paris ‚Äì #BlocusPourTheo : Tensions √† Nation, les forces de l'ordre pris √† partie, notamment des policiers en civils. pic.twitter.com/ZxRkOE2U2F
‚Äî Remy Buisine (@RemyBuisine) February 23, 2017
The French capital has been wracked with violence for over two weeks, with civil unrest spreading from the suburbs dominated by migrant and migrant-descended communities to the city centre .
Shock footage has emerged in recent days showing the police occasionally in full retreat, with squad cars racing down streets backwards before rampaging mobs.
Le snap de l'annee je diraisüòÇüòÇ pic.twitter.com/lrKvkgiJgY
‚Äî Younes 1x (@_youunes) February 13, 2017
Marine Le Pen, leader of the populist Front National and frontrunner in France‚Äôs upcoming presidential elections, has lambasted the incumbent government for its ‚Äúparalysis‚Äù in the face of increasing disorder and lawlessness.
‚ÄúThe forces of order are targeted by bands of scoundrels,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThe government is silent. A silence that reflects both its cowardice and its impotence.‚Äù
Hugues Moutouh, a former special advisor to France‚Äôs interior ministry, has accused elements of the political class of becoming ‚Äúaccomplices‚Äù to the violence by constantly seeking to justify it.
‚ÄúHopelessly smitten with idealism and naivety on the topic of security, the rancid Left sees every suburban youth who‚Äôs known to the police and has a foreign background as a victim of the system,‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúSocialists do not yet speak of [the riots] as an act of ‚Äòresistance‚Äô, but they are not far off.‚Äù
